TopicTitle: Fan Work Friday: Stranded on Duna

Articles.Content: <figure class=""><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_njaz1yTCuY1rr2wit.jpg"/></figure><figure class=""><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/7d95addd6d2e55daac0bd05111815bb6/tumblr_inline_njayoqX4351rr2wit.jpg"/></figure><p><b>Gmiezis</b> must’ve been in a situation that is all too familiar to most of us: stranded on Duna. It inspired him to make this painting of a mission gone wrong, which serves as a reminder to send that rescue mission before it’s too late!</p><p><a href="http://goo.gl/9ddREX">http://goo.gl/9ddREX</a><br/></p>
I gotta say that's a little creepy. I prefer Kerbals that just disappear when they die.
Wait, what? Oh, that's nothing. My eye's just bleeding water a little. They'll never know.

o7

You shall be remembered in the hearts of thousands, brave kerbonaut.
At least he died with a smile on his face.

Now the real question is. Is that Bill, Bob or Jeb?

Edit: Likely Jeb as this one be smiling.

Edited February 7, 2015 by Aragosnat
He's smiling right?
I'd rather have an antenna than a large hole in my helmet. Is he smiling? He looks like he is asleep, creepy. Kind of morbid, but the quality isn't bad.
Considering that it looks like suicide, I don't think it's Jebediah. Jeb wouldn't commit suicide just to end his life, much less smile peacefully while doing it.

So how did his helmet break? I thought that was impossible.....

Also. It's a very nice painting
i like that picture. Sad yet powerful. Such is the price of furthering kerbalkinds frontiers.
This brings back memories of my first successful Munar landing and the 12 rescue missions that chased after it.
For me, Duna is entirely green now...
He's smiling because he saw Duna before he died!
This is sort of creepy, especially considering the smile on his face. It's almost like he's dreaming. He died in peace, I guess.

This would add a new dimension to KSP, if it were to be implemented. If a Kerbal dies in a situation which doesn't involve massive pyrotechnics, we should be able to spot his/ her lifeless form lying on the ground or floating on the environmental liquid; possibly amongst debris. I suppose this might encourage players to play the game in one of two ways: the player in a more caring mood would try harder to prevent such failures. The player in a more "calloused" mood might go on a killer rampage of carnage. But at least in career mode, this latter behavior would yield negative consequences for the player.

So how did his helmet break? I thought that was impossible.....

Also. It's a very nice painting

On one video squad made f some version, Jeb, Bill, and Bob were on the mun and while two were in the view, a helmet came rolling to them, they then tried to take their helmets off.
Well, at least there isn't an "Alien" attached to his face.

great idea dude, I second that.

and also, awesome painting

Im an artist of all scopes myself, if my ADHD will allow me to stick with one long enuff to get good at it lol. Love the painting, I too know what it is like to be "Lost in space" game crashes too much to play mostly but I havent given up just yet

This would add a new dimension to KSP, if it were to be implemented. If a Kerbal dies in a situation which doesn't involve massive pyrotechnics, we should be able to spot his/ her lifeless form lying on the ground or floating on the environmental liquid; possibly amongst debris. I suppose this might encourage players to play the game in one of two ways: the player in a more caring mood would try harder to prevent such failures. Great idea, but perhaps a bit on the grim side. I mean, kids play this game! I wouldn't hold my breath for something like this in stock, but perhaps a mod could work to stick the kerbal in ragdoll mode when they die, or something.

Wow! Thanks Squad for posting this here!

And a big thank you to all of the people for nice words.

It definitely made my day. I better start working on the next one!

It's beautiful, but a little sad.

gmiezis, next time something a little happier? If your Kerbals smile like that when dead, I wanna see your rendition of Jeb when he's flying or something
May I suggest a tick box in the options panel to enable or disable "Kerbal Death" Problem solved everybody is happy

May I suggest a tick box in the options panel to enable or disable "Kerbal Death" Problem solved everybody is happy

yes, please

awesome picture btw.
